thread.title: TO DO: Haunted house in Boca, trolley tour in Delray
thread.title_full: TO DO: Haunted house in Boca, trolley tour in Delray | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: palmbeachpost
title: TO DO: Haunted house in Boca, trolley tour in Delray
text:
BOCA RATON
Like music?
The Enigma Haunt — 17,000 square feet of terror — is open through Nov. 1. Contributed Evening Star Productions is presenting its first show of the season, “35MM: A Musical Exhibition,” Thursday through Oct. 25 at the Sol Theatre. In “35MM,” each photo creates a unique song, a glimmer of a life unfolding. This is an intricately woven collection of stories told through song. $25; $10, students. 3333 N. Federal Highway. 561-447-8829; www.eveningstarproductions.org
Dangerous to tread here …
The Enigma Haunt , in its 16th year, stands ready once again to terrorize even the brave. This haunted house is open this Friday and Saturday. After that, days are Oct. 16-18, 22-25, 29-31 and Nov. 1. Hours are 7 to 10:30 p.m. Sunday and Thursday; 7 p.m. to midnight Friday and Saturday. The 17,000-square-foot Enigma Haunt features redesigned themed rooms and twists and turns in narrow passageways for in-your-face scares. It is indoors and runs each weekend, rain or shine. $20-$45. 21069 S. Military Trail. www.EnigmaHaunt.com
DELRAY BEACH
First tour of the season
The Spady Cultural Heritage Museum is hosting its first “Ride & Remember” Trolley Tour for 2015-16 season on Saturday. The tours, which run monthly on the second Saturday, make Delray Beach history come alive, with stories of the personalities, events and places that shaped the city. You’ll tour the Spady Museum, travel through the five historic districts and disembark at select historic sites for an up-close look. $25. 170 NW Fifth Ave. 561-279-8883 (reservations advised); www.spadymuseum.com
BOYNTON BEACH
Just in time for cooler weather
Enjoy the heated Denson Pool during the city’s Open Swim program, held five times a week: Tuesday-Friday, 1 to 4:30 p.m.; Saturday, noon to 5 p.m. Bring the family. Special-needs ramp available. Lifeguards on duty. Walk-in admission: $2, 18 and over; $1, 5-17; free, 4 and under. 225 NW 12th Ave. 561-742-6645; www.boynton-beach.org
</span
